title: Why We Struggle to Do Nothing
description: In today's world, stillness is often mistaken for laziness. But being idle doesn't mean being unproductive — it means allowing your mind to rest and reset.
body:
In today's world, stillness is often mistaken for laziness. But being idle doesn't mean being unproductive — it means allowing your mind to rest and reset.

“Almost everything will work again if you unplug it for a few minutes… including you.” — Anne Lamott

When you stop trying to fill every moment with activity, you make space for:

  • Creative ideas to emerge naturally
  • Deeper emotional processing
  • Physical recovery from constant busyness

So next time you're tempted to check your phone out of boredom, try just sitting with it. It may feel awkward at first, but it's a powerful form of self-care.
